How do I safely upgrade my Verus testnet without deleting any files?

Actually, if you've launched VRSCTEST from a version prior to this, you **should** delete the following directories before running this new update: `~/.komodo/VRSCTEST` and `~/.verustest` on Linux, `⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/VRSCTEST` and `⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩⁨/VerusTest` on Mac OS, and `"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST` and `"%APPDATA%"\VerusTest` on Windows. This ensures a clean start with the new testnet.

## Testnet Reset
The testnet was deleted and relaunched on this release. **IF YOU HAVE LAST LAUNCHED VRSCTEST FROM A VERSION PRIOR TO THIS, PLEASE DELETE THE FOLLOWING DIRECTORIES BEFORE RUNNING THIS NEW UPDATE:**
**Linux:**
```
~/.komodo/VRSCTEST
~/.verustest
```**MacOS**
```
 ⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/VRSCTEST
 ⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩⁨/VerusTest
```**Windows**
```
"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST
"%APPDATA%"\VerusTest
```**Launching the testnet:**
```
./verusd -chain=VRSCTEST
```# DisclaimerThis is experimental and unfinished software. Use at your own risk! No warranty for any kind of damage!
